coredata.dc:title: Trend Prediction of FDI Based on the Intervention Model and ARIMA-GARCH-M Model
coredata.prism:copyright: Copyright © 2012 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
coredata.prism:publisher: The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
coredata.prism:issueName: Conference on Modelling, Identification and Control
coredata.dc:creator: Shi, Hongyan
Zhang, Xin
Su, Xiaoming
Chen, Zhongju
coredata.dc:description: AbstractFor providing the government with effective monitoring of the trends of the economic variables in the future and good reference for developing a reasonable policy, in this paper, we establish a time series model on China's Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) by using wavelet analysis and intervention analysis and time series analysis and predict the trend of FDI in the next several years. This model eliminates the interference of noise for predicting by using wavelet analysis, and describes the autocorrelation and time-varying volatility of the financial time series by using ARIMA- GARCH-M model. The simulation results show that this model explains the dynamic structure of China's FDI trends well.
coredata.dcterms:subject: ARIMA model
GARCH-M model
Avelet de-noising
Autocorrelation
Prediction

ce:article-footnote.ce:note-para: Selection and/or peer review under responsibility of American Applied Science Research Institute.

head.ce:title: Trend Prediction of FDI Based on the Intervention Model and ARIMA-GARCH-M Model

ce:affiliation.ce:label: a
ce:affiliation.ce:textfn: School of Science,Shenyang University of Technolog, Shenyang ShenLiao Road, No. 111, Shenyang, 110000,China

ce:affiliation.ce:label: b
ce:affiliation.ce:textfn: Graduate School,Shenyang University of Technolog, Shenyang ShenLiao Road, No. 111, Shenyang, 110000,China

ce:affiliation.ce:label: c
ce:affiliation.ce:textfn: Liaoning Administrators College of Police and Justice,Shenyang Jialing River Street No.66, Shenyang, 110000,China

ce:abstract-sec.ce:simple-para: For providing the government with effective monitoring of the trends of the economic variables in the future and good reference for developing a reasonable policy, in this paper, we establish a time series model on China's Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) by using wavelet analysis and intervention analysis and time series analysis and predict the trend of FDI in the next several years. This model eliminates the interference of noise for predicting by using wavelet analysis, and describes the autocorrelation and time-varying volatility of the financial time series by using ARIMA- GARCH-M model. The simulation results show that this model explains the dynamic structure of China's FDI trends well.

sb:title.sb:maintitle: The Test for Chaotic Atractor in China's FDI Inflow and Its Nonlinear Dynamic Prediction:Based on Logistic Models
Intervention-ARIMA Forecasts of FDI in Hebei Province
